meanings.definition: The sails set forward of the mainmast on a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The foresails caught the wind and propelled the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to hoist the foresails to increase speed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the foresails and took a short nap.
meanings.sent4: Like a bird soaring on foresails, the ship glided gracefully through the water.
meanings.sent5: The white foresails billowed against the blue sky, a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The front sails of a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: The crew worked together to raise the foresails as they prepared to set sail.
meanings.sent2: The foresails fluttered in the breeze as the ship navigated the open sea.
meanings.sent3: A curious dolphin playfully leaped over the foresails, surprising the sailors.
meanings.sent4: The foresails stood tall and proud, leading the ship on its maritime journey.
meanings.sent5: In the distance, the foresails of the ship appeared like white wings against the horizon.
